page.title: 11DAIRY EXPERESS CREAMERIES
page.content: Ruyton Farmers co-operative was formed during the first part of world war 1 by a group of farmers in the area.They were directed by Mr W.H Gittins of Hall Farm,Ruyton X1 Towns.The dairy started at Hall Farm where they made Cheshire cheese. In l9l8 Hall Farm became too small.They moved to where the dairy now stands.In 1982 the most modern continuous cheesemaking plant was installed with a production capacity at 730,000 litres of milk to cheese daily. Milk is received at the dairy in bulk farm tankers.There are about 482 producers supplying milk to the factories on a daily basis to a maximum intake of about 560,000 litres per day.Cheese from Ruyton is automatically cut into blocks of 4.5 K.G and 2.3 K.G. blocks.
